title: I tried replicating this type.. What do you honestly think?
content:
I'm trying to get a typeface that exudes an 80's pop style.. Which one do you think is the best out of the three in this image... [http://onenine90.deviantart.com/art/80s-typography-139685261](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201103126/http:/onenine90.deviantart.com/art/80s-typography-139685261 "http://onenine90.deviantart.com/art/80s-typography-139685261")  
the bottom type of the image: I couldn't find a font that closely resembled the typography in this (in terms of the shape, not colour): [http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.ljplus.ru/img4/k/i/k...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201103126/http:/www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.ljplus.ru/img4/k/i/killacat/tb_logo_transparent_500.png "http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.ljplus.ru/img4/k/i/killacat/tb\_logo\_transparent\_500.png") so had to draw it myself. Does it pretty much look like the same typeface/style?

Any help is greatly appreciated (especially constructive criticism)! Thanks!
author: primouomo

comments.content: [Laser](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201103126/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/laser_std_virtual/) and [Rapier](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201103126/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/rapier_std_plain/) are essential scripts of the late eighties so I think your last logo is pretty good.
I think that you nailed the letterforms, but thereâ€™s something about the gradients that feels too digital as opposed to airbrushy.
